definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: In the computation of wave diffraction, thin layer of water is employed to simulate the breakwater.
sentences.chinese: 在计算堤后绕射中，采用了堤上薄膜水的方法。

sentences.english: When Sun Quan reached the city walls, arrows rained down on him, and one struck his plumed helmet.
sentences.chinese: 权自到城下看时，城上箭如雨发，射中孙权麾盖。

sentences.english: The hunter lodged an arrow in the tiger's head.
sentences.chinese: 猎人一箭射中老虎的头。

sentences.english: I played shoot the target with a crossbow and got a bulls eye!
sentences.chinese: 我用十字弓射中了目标还赢得了一只牛眼睛呢。

sentences.english: The same goes for shooting: he had no shots on or off target.
sentences.chinese: 也没有任何射门，无论是射中球门或者射飞。

sentences.english: A group of guards emerge from the door and shoot Jack with a Taser dart.
sentences.chinese: 一队警卫从门内现身，用高压电击枪射中了杰克。

sentences.english: He twanged an arrow that missed the target.
sentences.chinese: 他嗖地射出一支箭，但没有射中目标。

sentences.english: The bullet hit the centre of the target surely.
sentences.chinese: 那颗子弹不偏不倚地射中靶心。

sentences.english: He let go another arrow and hit the deer.
sentences.chinese: 他又发了一箭，射中了那只鹿。

sentences.english: Yunusova was injured in the shoot-out but survived.
sentences.chinese: 于鲁索娃在对射中受伤，但幸存了下来。

sentences.english: Guan Yu was hit by a poisonous arrow in the right arm while attacking Fancheng City.
sentences.chinese: 关羽攻打樊城时，被毒箭射中右臂。

sentences.english: He was shot in the shoulder with an arrow.
The arrow reached its mark and the bird fell dead.
sentences.chinese: 那枝箭射中鹄的，那只鸟坠地而死。

sentences.english: The tough-talking prime minister shot a female tiger with a tranquilizer gun after it had freed itself from a restraint.
sentences.chinese: 这位说话强硬的总理用镇静剂枪射中了一知雌性老虎。

definition: to shoot dead (with a gun, or bow and arrow)
to hit with a piercing blow
to penetrate/to pierce/to see clearly/to have an insight into
lit. one hundred shots, one hundred hits/to carry out a task with great precision/to shoot with unfailing accuracy/be a crack shot (idiom)
to meet violent death/to get killed
